contentrichtext.text: '''Ali Benflis''' ({{lang-ar|على بن فليس}}) (born September 8, 1944 in [[Batna City|Batna]]) is a politician from [[Algeria]], former [[Prime Minister of Algeria|Prime Minister]] from 2000 to 2003.<ref>{{cite news|title=Algeria's presidential challengers|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/3511120.stm|accessdate=30 October 2010|newspaper=BBC News|date=9 April 2004}}</ref> As of 2003, he is the general secretary of the [[National Liberation Front (Algeria)|National Liberation Front]] party. He was defeated in the Algerian presidential election of April 8, 2004 by President [[Abdelaziz Bouteflika]], taking only 6.4% of the vote. {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box|title=[[Prime Minister of Algeria]]|before=[[Ahmed Benbitour]]|after=[[Ahmed Ouyahia]]|years=2000–2003}} {{s-end}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{AlgerianPMs}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Benflis, Ali | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Algerian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = September 8, 1944 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Benflis, Ali}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Batna, Algeria]] [[Category:Chaoui people]] [[Category:National Liberation Front (Algeria) politicians]] {{Algeria-politician-stub}}
